short_description: aboriginal aquaculture is a business association based in campbell river, british columbia, canada.
long_description: aboriginal communities are in a unique position to benefit from sustainable aquaculture development due to their aquatic resources, rights and special access to aquaculture development sites. more than 50 aboriginal groups across canada have developed aquaculture business ventures and partnerships. this has resulted in new job creation and skills development. this has increased the wealth and prosperity in the rural and coastal communities providing both social and economic benefits. the aaa is able to provide business and technical services to aboriginal communities and entrepreneurs interested in developing sustainable aquaculture business ventures. includes support with planning, development and implementation of economic development opportunities in the aquaculture sector. identification of opportunities - new or expanded commercial production: shellfish, finfish, marine plants and freshwater - development and operation of businesses in the aquaculture supply and services sector. planning, feasibility analysis and preparation of business development plans.
business_tags: aquaculture | economic development opportunities | advisory services | training and educating | technical services | wealth and prosperity | business & development | planning & feasibility | development sites | site plan | fish farming | environmental sustainability | community & culture | shared decision making
generated_description: aboriginal aquaculture, legally known as aboriginal aquaculture association, based in campbell river, british columbia, is a national non-profit organization established in 2003. the organization aims to facilitate the meaningful participation of aboriginal communities and entrepreneurs in the aquaculture sector. it provides guidance and support for sustainable aquaculture development, regulation, and management. the association assists first nations in developing aquaculture business ventures, creating new job opportunities, and enhancing economic development. it promotes socioeconomic and environmental sustainability while respecting the autonomy and cultural values of first nations. the organization offers technical and advisory services, including planning, feasibility analysis, and business development support.
